programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''This is for the Birds'' - Exotic birds serve as the inspiration for this week's L'Oreal Challenge. The designers must really step up their game when Tim groups them into pairs and then tasks them to compete against each other. Francisco Costa guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''The Finale Challenge'' - The judges challenge the designers to each create a mini-collection. Actress Zoe Saldana guest judges.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Finale Part 1'' - Tim Gunn travels to the finalists' homes to check in on their progress before they head back to NYC.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Finale Part 2'' - Things get off to a bumpy start for the final designers as they frantically get ready to show at Fashion Week. With fair warning to step up their game, the designers make every minute of preparation count. Fashion designer L'Wren Scott guest judges, weighing in on who should be the winner during the intense debate at the final judging.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: ''Behind the Seams'' - In this "Project Runway" Season 9 wrap-up special, beloved mentor Tim Gunn reveals some of the show's biggest secrets and gives his unedited thoughts.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "A Times Square Anniversary Party" - For the 10th Anniversary of Project Runway, 16 new designers arrive in NYC with big dreams and a homework assignment: bring a garment that best represents their aesthetic. Upon arrival, they learn that for their first challenge they will have to create a companion piece to that look, and they will only have one day before they are presenting on the biggest stage in Project Runway history: the middle of Times Square!

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Candy Couture" - The designers participate in the always-anticipated Unconventional Materials Challenge of the season. This time around, the designers are tasked with making a garment entirely from items that are found in Dylan's Candy Bar.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Welcome Back (or not) to the Runway" - The designers are broken into teams of two, where they are tasked to design a red carpet look to be worn at the Emmys. Each team is assigned a client to design for, and this client is one of several past contestants on Project Runway. Each outfit is also inspired by a different color Lexus, which serves as their mode of transportation in the beginning of this episode.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Women on the Go" - For the Michael Kors Challenge, the designers are tasked with making an outfit for a woman on the go—something chic and stylish but wearable enough to last throughout the entire day. Also, the designers are left in a state of confusion as two of their fellow competitors abruptly decide to leave Project Runway.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "It's My Way on the Runway" - In the Marie Claire Challenge, the designers are once again split off into teams to design a fashion capsule collection for the new magazine Marie Claire at Work. The teams also must direct a fashion shoot for their collection, which is also part of the criteria they are judged on for this challenge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Fix My Friend" - In a challenge for L'Oreal, the designers team up with clients whose friends or loved ones are in desperate need of a makeover. The designers must consult and work with their clients to give them a new and flattering look that is also conducive to their lifestyle.

programme.desc: In February 1942 US forces engaged an unidentified flying object above Los Angeles. Now almost 70 years later, the alien invaders have returned.

programme.title: CarGo

programme.title: Dragonquest
programme.desc: After the ruthless Krill (Brian Thompson) harnesses the power of a deadly fire-breathing dragon, he begins a bloody campaign of world domination. From the ashes of a scorched village, Arkadi (Daniel Bonjour), an unassuming farm boy, embarks on an arduous journey to restore the lost pieces of a mystical amulet -- the only weapon powerful enough to destroy Krill. With the help of swordsman Maxim (Marc Singer) and his squire, Katya (Jennifer Dorogi), Arkadi struggles to save the world.

programme.title: Hercules Reborn
programme.desc: When a young man's bride is kidnapped by an evil king, he turns to Hercules for help. The fallen hero has been living in exile, banished for killing his family, but the young man's courage inspires Hercules. Together, they fight to rescue the bride and reclaim Hercules' honor.

programme.title: Kyle Kuzma Shows Up in Supreme and PJ Tucker Keeps It Comfy | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week, hosts Racks Hogan, Kalysse Anthony and Mouse Jones get into it over PJ Tucker's satin Dolce & Gabbana outfit, and break down Kevin Durant and Kyle Kuzma's pre-game fits. Then, celebrity stylist Derek Roche shows us how to put looks together for a tall, athletic basketball player. Plus, the hosts go head-to-head in a game of Guess Who, and celebrate the legacies of Dwyane Wade and Dirk Nowitzki.

programme.title: Detroit Pistons Langston Galloway vs Nike SB Collector in a Sneaker Battle From Home!
programme.desc: On this episode we have NBA player and sneaker collector, Langston Galloway, from the Detroit Pistons going up against Complex's "Best Kept Secret" Kevin Luyster in an epic Sneaker Battle From Home! Both came equipped with a variety of sneakers in an all out 5 round battle! You won't get any spoilers here, watch the episode and decide for yourself on who won this battle!

programme.title: Qias Omar vs HesKicks In A Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX

They both started their respective channels back in 2012, Heskicks vs Qias Omar, is a battle of old school collecting versus new school hype! The two put on a display of versatility for the public in an incredible 5 round battle! Make sure you watch and debate for yourself on who won this battle!

programme.title: Lavar Ball vs Jacques Slade In A Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX

In one corner, he is an OG to the Sneaker Youtube space, some would consider him the Godfather of sneaker unboxing videos, @Jacques Slade aka Kustoo is here to battle! His opponent is the undefeated one, this man NEVER LOST a single competition of any sort in his life, Lavar Ball is here to battle! Watch the battle and let us know who won this matchup!

programme.title: Watch King Combs Choose Between Drake & Pusha T for Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: Complex Brackets is a new game show from Complex News where your favorite celebs choose the best rapper in any one of these four categories: Best East Coast Rapper, Best West Coast Rapper, Best Rapper of the Decade, and Best Rapper of All Time. In this episode, King Combs hits a wall when he has to choose between Drake and Pusha T for the crown of Best Rapper of the Decade. Be sure to check out Complex Brackets every Monday at 2:00pm EST right here on Complex News.

programme.title: Moneybagg Yo Crowns The Best Rapper of the Decade | Complex Brackets
programme.desc: The Dirty South dominates throughout this episode when Moneybagg Yo sticks to his roots as he goes through our Best Rapper of the Decade bracket. The Memphis rapper delivered upset after upset while being faced with tough choices between hip hop giants and rappers who spoke to his life growing up. Make sure you share your choices in the comments below. Would you have picked the same?

programme.title: James Harden Rocks Louis Vuitton and Chris Paul Reps Black-Owned Brands | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On the latest "Tunnel Takedown," hosts Kalysse Anthony, Mouse Jones and Racks Hogan can't agree on Russell Westbrook's latest look and break down why James Harden's Louis Vuitton outfit missed the mark. Then, we shout out Chris Paul for his support of black designers, and Racks explains how to tell the difference between an original vintage t-shirt and a reproduction.

programme.title: The Perfect New York Slice with Frank Pinello and Michael Imperioli | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: In New York City, pizza isn't just food, it's a way of life. But which iconic NY-style dish reigns supreme: the Sicilian square or the classic round pie? In the series premiere of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Best Pizza's Frank Pinello to find out which slice is the true king of New York. And who better to judge the event than legendary actor and pizza obsessive Michael Imperioli?

programme.title: Binging with Babish Judges Movie-Inspired Pizzas: Nicole Russell vs Mike Greenfield | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Which movie-inspired pizza reigns supreme: the broccoli-topped pie from Inside Out, or "pizza in a cup" from The Jerk? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, Binging with Babish has challenged her and Pro Home Cooks' Mike Greenfield to take his silver-screen recreations to the next level. Will Nicole's Cup O' Pizza earn her a much-needed victory following a tough loss to Frank Pinello in Episode 1?

programme.title: The Ultimate Viral Pizza Showdown with Mike Hauke, Mark Iacono, and Scott Wiener | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Ramen, tacos, cheeseburgers, fried chicken-Mike Hauke of Tony Boloney's can turn just about anything into a pizza. But has the undisputed king of Instagramable pies finally met his match? In a brand new episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell attempts to wrestle the crown from Dr. Franken-slice in a viral pizza showdown for the ages. Will Nicole's popcorn-crusted bar pie be enough to topple Mike's bone-in "Flaming Cowboy"? Only pizza pros Mark Iacono and Scott Wiener can decide.

programme.title: Sean Evans and Farideh Sadeghin Taste Test Chicago Deep Dish Made by Two New Yorkers | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Can two thin-crust loving New Yorkers make deep dish pizza fit for a Chicago native? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza maker she must face off against Josephine Giordano of Lenny's Pizza to see if she can conquer the Windy City's most controversial culinary export. Will Nicole's chicken parm-packed deep dish be enough to the win the favor of Muchies' Farideh Sadeghin and Chicago native Sean Evans?

programme.title: The Perfect Detroit-Style Pizza with Cliff Skighwalker, Adam Richman, and Reina Scully | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Detroit is home to some of America's most delicious pizza. But who can create the ultimate Motor City-inspired slice? As host Nicole Russell continues her quest to become the world's next master pizza-maker, she must face off against chef Cliff Skighwalker in a good ol' fashioned pan-pizza throwdown.

programme.title: Mythical Chef Josh and Nicole Russell Make Taco Bell and Beef Patty Inspired Pizzas | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: Pizza is the ultimate blank canvas for culinary innovation. In this episode of Pizza Wars, host Nicole Russell faces off against Mythical Chef Josh to see who can create the ultimate "mashup pie." At Mythical Kitchen, Josh has perfected the art of fast-food fusion, but will his Doritos Locos Taco Pizza be enough to take down Nicole's Jamaican beef patty-inspired pie? The choice is up to this week's judges: Complex's Speedy Morman and chef Jae Lee of Nowon in NYC.

programme.title: Neapolitan-Style Pizza at Home with Vito Iacopelli, Nicole Russell, and Daym Drops | Pizza Wars
programme.desc: It's the season finale of Pizza Wars, and host Nicole Russell must now battle the final boss: master pizzaiolo Vito Iacopelli. Will Nicole's tandoori-inspired pizza be enough to impress food review legend Daym Drops, or will Vito's "connolo-style" slice steal the golden pizza trophy away from her for good? Only one oven can handle a pizza cage match of this magnitude: The Ooni Koda 16. Tune in to a very special episode of Pizza Wars to see who comes out on top.

programme.title: Maluma Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Global Colombian superstar Maluma goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Flight Club in Miami and talks about his love for the Nike Mags, meeting Virgil Abloh, and seeing his grandfather's appreciation for New Balance.

programme.title: Sean Evans Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Hot Ones host Sean Evans goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about his favorite sneakers growing up, getting his own Reebok collaboration, and some of his trademark sneakers.

programme.title: Roman Reigns Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: WWE superstar Roman Reigns goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Solefly in Miami and talks wearing Jordans in the ring, admiring Ken Griffey Jr. and having the best sneaker game in wrestling.

programme.title: Moneybagg Yo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Moneybagg Yo goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about his mom working for Nike in Memphis, winning dice games to get money for sneakers, and his crazy sneaker collection.

programme.title: Soulja Boy Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Soulja Boy goes Sneaker Shopping at SoleStage in Los Angeles and talks about being the rapper who started the Bape trend, being the first rapper to wear Nike Mags, buying Kanye West's Louis Vuitton sneakers in Cancun, and how lucrative his Yums sneaker deal was.

programme.title: Pharrell Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Pharrell Williams goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at The Webster in Miami and talks about Nigo giving him Bape sneakers, why his Ice Cream sneakers were blurred out of the "Drop It Like It's Hot" video, his sneaker history, and Adidas collaborations, and more.

programme.title: Karol G Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Multi-platinum reggaeton artist Karol G joins Complex's Joe La Puma at Flight Club in New York City to talk about getting Air Force 1s while growing up in Colombia, why she loves Air Jordan 4s, and why she thinks J Balvin's Air Jordan 1s are important.

programme.title: Michael Strahan Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: NFL Hall of Famer Michael Strahan goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods for the Season 12 finale and talks about getting Air Jordans 1s in 1985, sitting front row at Kanye West's Yeezy Season fashion show, and his viral prank of getting his teeth fixed.

programme.title: Rod Wave Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Multi-platinum artist Rod Wave goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Kickzr4us in Tampa, Florida, and talks about his latest album, giving away Air Jordans, and his favorite Nike SB Dunks.

programme.title: Rowdy Rebel Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: Rowdy Rebel joins Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about his favorite Air Jordans, wearing Off-White x Air Jordan 1s when he went home, and wanting to go shopping with Bobby Shmurda in the future.

programme.title: G Herbo Goes Sneaker Shopping With Complex
programme.desc: G Herbo goes Sneaker Shopping with Complex's Joe La Puma at Stadium Goods in New York City and talks about how he used to clean sneakers growing up, camping out for shoes, and why he loves Air Force 1s so much.

programme.title: How to Cook a Double-Dipped Roast Beef Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: The double-dipped roast beef burger is an icon of Brooklyn, New York, and Burger Scholar George Motz is here to teach you how to make one at home. This regional one-off burger-known locally as the "Gargiulo"- hails from the historic roast-beef emporium Brennan & Carr. Here, the burger patty is topped with freshly sliced roast beef, sauteed onions, American cheese, and is eventually dunked in a vat of piping hot beef broth.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Steakhouse Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz usually smashes his patties with childlike glee. But today, he has his eyes set on a different prize: the luxurious, thick, dry-aged steakhouse burger! The beauty of this style is its lack of adornments-a juicy patty, cheese, and a sturdy bun, which all help emphasize the beef. In the words of Motz: "Take the upgrade people!" Without further ado, learn how to cook a perfect steakhouse burger at home!

programme.title: How to Cook a Loose Meat Sandwich with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Here's a weird one for you-the Loose Meat Sandwich from the Midwest. Is it a hamburger? We're not entirely sure. Is it amazing? Hell yes! Think of a Sloppy Joe, minus the slop. If you close your eyes and bite into a loose meat sandwich, you taste all the elements of a hamburger: bun, beef, seasoning, mustard, onion, pickle. And now it's George's job to bring this Midwest icon into your home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Mississippi Slugburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a hyper-regional slugburger from Northern Mississippi. Borne out of the Great Depression, the slugburger patty combines beef and bread crumbs-a method that was used to extend the meat supply. As the bread crumbs toast on the griddle, they absorb the rendered beef fat, creating the ultimate crispy burger. Here is your master class on how to make a regional slugburger at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Texas-Style Smoked Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz has taught us about fried burgers and steamed burgers, but did you know about the smoked burger from Texas? In this episode, George teaches you how to apply the principles of barbecue to a burger. With a simple offset smoker set-up, you can achieve the perfect smoke ring on this burger right in your own backyard. Here is your master class on the Texas smoked burger.

programme.title: How to Cook a Hawaiian Loco Moco Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is here to set the record straight: A real homegrown Hawaiian burger is NOT a beef patty topped with pineapple and ham. When locals crave a burger, they order something called the loco moco. Technically a 'burger plate,' this regional icon is a burger patty placed on a bed of rice, drenched in gravy, and topped with a fried egg. A popular late-night order at diners, the loco moco is one of George's favorite burgers to eat. And now's your chance to make one at home.

programme.title: How to Cook a Deep-Fried Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In our season finale, Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook a regional specialty from Tennessee: The deep-fried burger! At a place called Dyer's in Memphis, burgers are smashed paper thin and dipped in a skillet filled with hot beef tallow-a method that harkens back to the dawn of the original hamburger. Grease is an heirloom at Dyer's. When you bite into a burger from there, you're biting into history. That's because the same grease has been used since 1912!

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Patty Melt with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook his favorite patty melt! Motz says this is the burger he dreams about all the time, and you'll quickly learn why it's so unique. Borrowing a method from Wisconsin burger shacks, Motz poaches the hamburger patty in beef stock and slides it in between a grilled cheese. This is truly regional hamburger nirvana.

programme.title: How to Cook a Perfect Double Cheeseburger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz teaches you how to cook one of the most important hamburgers in America-the original double cheeseburger from Southern California's iconic Bob's Big Boy Restaurant. This is the double burger that birthed all other double burgers (and even predates the invention of the Big Mac by almost 30 years!). Learn how to make a perfect double cheeseburger at home while soaking up some hamburger history.

programme.title: How to Cook 2 Regional Fast-Food Burgers with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: Burger Scholar George Motz is taking you on a ride through regional American fast-food burger history! A lot of the big, commercial fast-food places have given the hamburger a bad wrap. Which is why George wants to set the record straight and show you two family-owned, hyper-regional burger chains that still do it right-Swensons in Ohio, and Fat Mo's in Tennessee. These beloved burgers are highly unique, and take a few twists and turns to get to the finished product.

programme.title: How to Cook a Spicy Malaysian Egg Burger with George Motz | Burger Scholar Sessions
programme.desc: In this special episode of Burger Scholar Sessions, George Motz pulls back the curtain on an international street-food icon: the spicy Malaysian egg burger! This burger is so famous that it goes by several names-the Ramly Burger, the Sloppy Burger, and the "Sampah" Burger, which translates to "rubbish" in Malaysia. But this burger isn't rubbish at all it's a total flavor bomb. Wrapped in an egg and covered with spices, it's one of the craziest burgers George has ever tried.

programme.title: Lorde Drops the Mic While Eating Spicy Wings | Hot Ones
programme.desc: Lorde is a two-time Grammy Award-winning singer-songwriter, and she's back with her much-anticipated third studio album, Solar Power. The latest single, "Stoned at the Nail Salon," is out now, and there's a multi-continent tour set to begin next year. But how is she with spicy food? Find out as the New Zealand pop powerhouse takes on the wings of death and discusses the sound of cicadas, the art of songwriting, and the keys to a perfect onion ring

programme.title: Who Took The Bomp? Le Tigre on Tour
programme.desc: WHO TOOK THE BOMP? LE TIGRE ON TOUR follows iconic feminist electronic band Le Tigre on their 2004-2005 international tour. Le Tigre confronts sexism and homophobia in the music industry while tearing up the stage with their no-holds-barred lyrics, punk rock ethos, and whip-smart wit.

programme.title: Wild Combination: A Portrait Of Arthur Russell
programme.desc: Director Matt Wolf's critically acclaimed documentary examines the life and work of Arthur Russell, an influential singer, songwriter, cello player and disco auteur who died tragically in 1992. The film blends archival footage with illuminating interview segments featuring some of Russell's colleagues and most notable collaborators, including poet Allen Ginsberg, composer Philip Glass and indie pop sensation Jens Lekman.

Mother's Little Helpers is a funny, dysfunctional family drama, based on true lies, about how family ties can twist and tear you - and though they may not break you, they might send you to prison. It explores the "OK, Boomer" relationship between the free love generation and those left behind to clean up the mess.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: "Toxic Forces" - Amanda Reese breaks out in hives and begins to hyperventilate after returning from a Hurricane Katrina relief effort. Dr. G wonders if an infection caused this young woman's untimely death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In an affluent suburb of Philadelphia, police were called to the scene of what appeared to be an accidental drowning. The investigation gradually focused on one person, a suspect who had more than a million reasons to want the victim dead.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind - tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three seemingly unrelated deaths proved to be serial murders. The killer had been careful - he used poison which had no taste or odor. Fortunately for investigators, it also had a unique chemical signature.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Armed with little else, police hoped the shoe impressions found at a Lansing, Michigan crime scene would put their investigation of Audrey Nichols' murder back on track.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the head chef of a historic Philadelphia restaurant was found dead, investigators interviewed the usual suspects: family, friends and coworkers. As they sifted through the evidence, police uncovered a chilling tale of debt and deceit.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A killer tried to incinerate and destroy everything that could link him to his crime. But in doing so, he inadvertently created new forensic evidence, evidence which came to light with a technique never before used in a criminal investigation.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a successful stockbroker doesn't return home after a late shift, his wife reports him missing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The prime suspect had a criminal record and his driver's license was found at the scene of a brutal double homicide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a little girl got sick and died, investigators were stumped. Was it an accident, an unexplained illness or murder?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a car was found in a drainage ditch with two bodies inside, a fingertip torn from a latex glove would point investigators to both the crime scene and the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman who was known to have suffered from depression took her own life. But her sister told police that she said if anything were to happen to her there would be a note in the china cabinet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An aspiring model turned up dead and the prime suspect was her boyfriend. When he was eventually cleared, investigators had to dig deeper to find the perpetrator.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Crane Cannon Launch/Trash Scavenger Hunt/Heli Body Drag" - This episode featured four pairs as teams. First, it's the human cannonball. As a truck drives along a pier with a crane hanging off the side, one team member hangs from a crane and then into the water they light the fuse to giant cannon. Their partner is shot out of the cannon and into the water, swim to a boat and clip a flag to a flagpole. The team to finish fastest chooses team to be eliminated. Next, it's a trash can buffet scavenger hunt. Teams dig through dumpsters and barrels to find items. The team to match four items fastest would win a four-day trip to Las Vegas and $20,000. No one would be eliminated. The final stunt is a real drag. Team members hanging on to handlebars attached to a helicopter and are dragged across pavement on their stomachs. They have to let go as close to the finish line as possible. The team to get the least combined distance from the finish line would win $50K. The home invasion stunt goes to Dubuque, Iowa.

programme.title: Greg McHale's Wild Yukon: You Wanted and Adventure: Dall's Sheep Part 1

Northern weather is unforgiving and a thick blanket of fresh snow welcomes Greg on this August hunt. Tough weather conditions and sparse sheep make this a hunt for the books. A close encounter with a wolverine and the packrafting access all add to the adventure. Tune in to see whether Greg can find rams in Part 1 of this double episode.

programme.title: No Kitchen Required
programme.desc: Michael, Madison and Kayne speed across the South Seas toward Fiji, a land where the locals were once feared. They disembark on a sandbar and half wade, half swim to the blindingly white shores. The cooking competition becomes fierce as the chefs battle to win the hearts of their Fijian hosts.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet creates beautifully baked comfort food for a Sunday lunch: Warm Crumble Tart, Pasta Pie and the Ultimate Chocolate Fudge Cake. Later, she’s joined by award winning baker Julie Jones for a lesson in pie art and visits a meeting of the Pudding Club in the Cotswolds.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella shares the secrets of her celebratory, yet simple Italian roast chicken, served alongside a sunny saffron orzotto. Dessert comes courtesy of Nigella's surprisingly easy coffee ice cream.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella treats her friends to an Italian inspired supper of pork loin stuffed with Parma ham and oregano, served alongside her speedy mock mash and lazy person's vignarola.

programme.title: Nigellissima
programme.desc: Nigella introduces us to her love of Italian food through a spectacular yet simple Sicilian pasta with tomatoes, garlic and almonds a mid week family feast of Tagliata - a juicy steak cut into thin slices - served with crisp, fluffy Tuscan fries.

programme.title: From the Tastemade Kitchen
programme.desc: We all love those smokey flavors of slow roasted goodness, so let your BBQ flag fly high with BBQ pulled pork rolls, beer & honey BBQ chicken skewers, and BBQ fried ribs. Sticky yet delicious!

programme.title: From the Tastemade Kitchen
programme.desc: Nothing helps out a host more than arriving with a tasty dip...but have you ever made a Korean BBQ chicken dip, loaded baked potato dip, or even a pizza dip? Might be time to start prepping for your next block party!

programme.title: From the Tastemade Kitchen
programme.desc: Three cheers for these fabulous fixins which all have a little bit o’ beer in them. We’ve got beer-battered fish tacos, beer & cheese soup, black beer chicken, and more. Now ‘hop’ to it and get cookin’.

programme.title: From the Tastemade Kitchen
programme.desc: No need to turn your stove on for these delicious raw dishes! We've got poke tuna tacos, avocado pesto, and a crunchy raw veggie sushi that is sure to make your meal both filling and flavorful.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Chef Keith Corbin is showing off his ability to take southern cuisine favorites and make them new again, as only a professional Chef can, with seasonal ingredients and a few tricks he’s learned along the way. On the menu - Seasonal Spring Vegetable Salad with Honey Berbere Dressing, Fish and Grits, and Ginger & Black Pepper Strawberry Shortcake. This is one for the books!

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Chef Joe Sasto uses the entire ear of corn to create custom creamy cacio e pepe cavatelli. We’re talking cob, kernel, and husk - and for dessert, he’s making a sweet summery strawberry cobbler that you won’t soon forget.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: For Chef Shirley Chung, growing up in Beijing, meant everything was dipped in sesame sauce! Here she is reinventing another childhood favorite, lamb kabobs, and transforming it into Beijing Spiced Lamb Chops with Sesame Sauce. And that’s not all, to round out the meal, she is pairing it with homemade Sesame Noodles and a summer corn and jalapeno dish, a nod to her California days.

programme.title: Make this Tonight
programme.desc: Growing up in New York City’s culinary melting pot, gave Chef Jamie Lauren an appreciation of vibrant and bold flavors from an early age. In this episode, she is combining some of her childhood favorites into one epic dish - Flavorful Jerk Chicken is piled high served on fresh corn tortillas with Cuban Style Black Beans, Sweet Plantains, Quick Pickles Onions, and homemade Habanero Hot Sauce.

programme.title: Struggle Meals
programme.desc: Keep your pantry stocked with a few basic staples, and you’ll always have ingredients on hand for dinner, especially for pasta night. In this episode, Frankie creates delicious pasta dishes with the kitchen’s best-kept secret weapon – the pantry.

programme.title: The Latin Kitchen
programme.desc: Juan Pablo Gonzalez inspires us with corn recipes from his home country.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Chef Lauren Gulyas mixes wild rice and walnuts.

programme.title: Ribs and Mashed Potatoes Revisited
programme.desc: Bridget Lancaster shares steps to achieving the perfect Memphis-style Wet Ribs in the Slow Cooker. Next, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host, Julia Collin Davison to an apple-cider vinegar tasting. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore teaches Bridget how to make the leftover favorite, Mashed Potato Cakes from scratch.

programme.title: A Trip to Tarheel Country
programme.desc: Test cook Bryan Roof shows host Julia Collin Davison a top-secret recipe for North Carolina Dipped Fried Chicken. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of chocolate ice cream. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore makes Bridget a classic version of North Carolina Lemon Pie.

programme.title: Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster make a Lone Star State classic-Flank Steak in Adobo. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for inexpensive blenders. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Julia how to make the ultimate Texas Breakfast Tacos.

programme.title: Summer Dinner Party
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison goes into the test kitchen with test cook Dan Souza to learn how to make the ultimate Grill-Roasted Beef Tenderloin. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews gas grills in the Equipment Corner. Then, gadget expert Lisa McManus uncovers the best quirky gadgets. Finally, test cook Erin McMurrer shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make an elegant Pear-Walnut Upside-Down Cake.

programme.title: Korean Feast
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make dolsot bibimbap. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews spider skimmers in the equipment corner. Finally, test cook Dan Souza prepares Korean-style fried chicken wings.

programme.title: Pad Thai and Panang Curry
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia prepare pad thai. Tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a tasting of coconut milk. Next, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews electric kettles. And finally, test cook Elle Simone makes panang beef curry.

programme.title: Mediterranean Sweets
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes host Bridget Lancaster the ultimate Olive Oil Cake. Finally, Julia and Bridget uncover the secrets to making foolproof Baklava at home.

programme.title: Dumplings and Noodles
programme.desc: Test cook Dan Souza makes Bridget Chinese-style pork dumplings. Gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews ginger graters. Finally, test cook Keith Dresser makes Julia zha jiang mian.

programme.title: Chicken and Biscuits
programme.desc: Test cook Becky Hays and host Julia Collin Davison make the perfect Indoor Pulled Chicken with Sweet and Tangy Barbecue Sauce. Tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a tasting of basmati rice, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews the gadgets you didn't know you needed, and test cook Erin McMurrer unlocks the secrets to making Ultimate Flaky Buttermilk Biscuits at home.

programme.title: Steak House Dinners
programme.desc: The perfect steakhouse dinner-salad with creamy blue cheese dressing and seared filet mignon-is often a fantasy. In the real world, the lettuce is limp, the dressing gluey or watery, the steak overcooked or not properly browned, and the sauce characterless. The test kitchen shows you how to solve each of these problems.

programme.title: Fried Rice and Kung Pao Shrimp
programme.desc: We show you how to prepare fried rice and kung pao shrimp. Our findings about rice cookers and long-grain white rice guarantee perfect rice every time.

programme.title: Freedom from Red Sauce
programme.desc: Tomatoes and pasta are a classic (and delicious) pairing, but sometimes you want a change. Vegetable sauces, like the two featured in this episode-one with mushrooms and one with broccoli rabe-are appealing options.

programme.title: Easy Sheet Cakes
programme.desc: A sheet cake is like a two-layer cake with training wheels-it's hard to fall off. But sheet cakes are still cakes. They can still turn out dry, sticky, or flavorless, and on occasion they can even sink in the middle. The test kitchen decided to tackle two popular sheet cakes-carrot and chocolate-and produce simple recipes that would deliver superior results.

programme.title: Flash in a Pan
programme.desc: Far too often, quick and easy weeknight cooking reflects the minimal effort exerted to make the meal. But it doesn't have to be this way. We start with two quick-cooking classics- sautéed chicken cutlets and pan-seared shrimp-and elevate them from the everyday.

programme.title: Texas Rib House
programme.desc: Huge meaty flavor-combined with spice, smoke, and fire-epitomizes Texas barbecue. Could we figure out how to make authentic Texas beef ribs in our Boston-based test kitchen?

programme.title: Grill-Roasted Pork Loin
programme.desc: Pork loin is delicious roasted in the oven, but it takes on a new character when cooked on the grill. The fire imparts a delicate smokiness to the meat, and the intense heat creates a handsome crust. French potato salad-sliced red potatoes dressed with a zippy herb-infused vinaigrette-is a perfect counterpoint to the pork.

programme.title: Fish Steaks 101
programme.desc: Tuna, which is often served rare to medium-rare, can be particularly tricky to get just right, especially when you want a nicely seared crust. As for halibut, the texture of this fish usually fares better in a moist-heat cooking method such as braising, but this technique often means a loss of flavor. We develop the best recipes to highlight the best of both fish.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Empire Kitchen Pop’s for Italian Detroit Axe
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Musonda Mwila, Michael Sanders and Michelle Dritsan, who review bistro fare and craft cocktails at the Empire Kitchen true Italian fare with homemade pasta, of course, at Pop's for Italian and a casual menu of eats at the high-energy Detroit Axe restaurant.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Galápagos Islands
programme.desc: Chef Staib journeys to the famed Galápagos Islands. He explores the vast wildlife, samples coffee produced from volcanic soil, and tastes the local ceviche made from an endemic species of the islands.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - A Meal to Impress
programme.desc: Martin and his guest, Michael Lomonaco, show us how to impress your friends and be the life of any dinner party with these unique dishes.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Tomatoes
programme.desc: Take Tomatoes to the next level with Mushroom and Tomato Bell Pepper Quiche, Spicy Corn Tomato Relish, Tomato Basil Salad.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Kaspar Donier, Kevin Rathbun, and Keegan Gerhard
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Pickled Chanterelles, Boar Chops and Cous Cous, and Roasted Apples with Warm Apple Soup. Restaurants include: Kaspar’s in Seattle, Nava in Atlanta, and The Ritz-Carlton in Naples.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Noodle and Dumpling Chronicles
programme.desc: Like an Italian with a bowl of spaghetti or tortellini, a Korean eating a heap of noodles or dumplings is a satisfied customer. In Korea, slurping is not only permitted, it’s considered a compliment to the cook. This episode features a restaurant in Seoul known for its nenngymyun, an unusual dish of elastic buckwheat noodles served with ice-cold beef broth.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - King of Alaska
programme.desc: The mighty Yukon River is the longest river in Alaska and the third longest in North America. Its 2300‐mile stretch of pristine glacier‐fed waters holds the most legendary and mystical salmon in the world‐ the Yukon River King Salmon. In this episode, master seafood chef Rick Moonen ventures to this remote region to meet what he calls, “The best fish I ever ate.”

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Mexican Chicken
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking Mexican chicken, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Lamb Potato Casserole & Lamb Patties
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Lamb Potato Casserole & Lamb Patties!

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Sugar and Honey
programme.desc: Sticky sweetness highlights this segment of Hawaii Cooks. A visit to Manoa Honey Company reveals how this golden by-product of bees is harvested, while at the same time ensuring that Hawaii’s agricultural industry remains pollinated. Although sugar once dominated the agricultural landscape in Hawaii, sugar production has now dwindled down to two locations on Kauai and Maui.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Fried Rice
programme.desc: Seasoned rice and wheat berries stir-fried with Canadian bacon, sun-dried tomatoes, green onions and eggs are served as a main course or rolled in tender collard leaves and served with salsa.

programme.title: Travel Man - Budapast
programme.desc: Richard and comedian Aisling Bea make a whirlwind tour of Hungary's fairy-tale capital, with selfies, goulash, cake, pubs, liquor, and a game of chess at the thermal baths.

programme.desc: Richard and Rhod Gilbert's high-speed visit to Florida's famous hot spot takes in art, art deco, alligators, speedboats, an airboat tour of the everglades - and dominoes.

programme.title: Travel Man - Christmas Special: Florence
programme.desc: Hollywood actor Rebel Wilson joins Richard for a fun-packed whizz round Florence in a mini-break mixing art, action, gelato, a drive in a classic Alfa Romeo, and some tripe.

programme.title: Travel Man - New York
programme.desc: Richard and comedian Katherine Ryan take a fast and funny trip to New York. Their overflowing schedule includes skyscrapers, roller blades, museums, ferries, show-tunes and cronuts.

programme.title: Travel Man - Helsinki
programme.desc: Hollywood actor Paul Rudd joins Richard to discover Finland's seaside capital, with a time-efficient exploration by kayak, a good steaming in the city's saunas and salty sweets.

programme.title: Travel Man - Lisbon
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Adam Buxton joins Richard for a high-speed tour of Portugal's capital, with trams, rickshaw, funicular and fado, and a visit to a doll hospital.

programme.title: Travel Man - Naples
programme.desc: Watch Richard and Jack Dee take a trip to Naples featuring humor, history, culture, pizza, Vespas and chaotic traffic, a trip to Capri, and a guide to the meaning of dreams.

programme.title: Extreme Builds: Jim & Lissa (Part.1)
programme.desc: Lissa is unhappy living in Sarasota, Florida and wants to move back to Santa Monica, California. In an effort to keep Lissa in Florida and happy Jim is building her their dream home. programme.title: Extreme Builds: Jim & Lissa (Part.2)

The problems continue with their builders and Jim and Lissa consider finishing the home without them.

programme.desc: Harlem bride Corryn Conyer has dreamt of looking like Audrey Hepburn on her wedding day. When David meets Corryn three weeks before her big day, he realizes her wedding was far from a fairytale ending.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Pirate Bride
programme.desc: David Tutera has planned plenty of destination weddings, but never met a bride pleading for "Pirates of the Caribbean" themed nuptials. With only 21 days to go, missing the mark on this one might mean David will be walking the plank!

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Day of the Dead Bride
programme.desc: A bride wants to celebrate death on her wedding day? Over David Tutera's dead body! Watch as he transforms this nuptial nightmare into a celebration that would make Tim Burton jealous.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Greek Goddess Bride
programme.desc: David Tutera's next bride thinks her fiance is a Greek god and that means a Greek themed wedding. But her idea of statues, golden centerpieces and white loose robes suggests to David he'll have to tread with caution.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Phantom of the Opera Bride
programme.desc: David's newest bride is hoping to recreate the glamour and drama of The Phantom of the Opera, but her execution is something out of a high school play. Can David save this production?

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Alice in Wonderland Bride
programme.desc: With his new bride's heart set on an Alice in Wonderland themed wedding, David Tutera has to help her dark and dreary concept into an elegant and modern take on the classic tale.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Wizard of Oz Bride
programme.desc: David Tutera meets a bride whose Wizard of Oz themed wedding has him spinning in circles. Does David's bride have the courage and heart to deal with all of his changes?

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Monopoly Bride
programme.desc: David Tutera assists a bride who is trying to incorporate the board game Monopoly into her wedding. David takes on this huge challenge and gets right to work to make the classic board game come to life at her wedding.

programme.title: My Fair Wedding: Goth Bride
programme.desc: Bride Kristina wants a Goth wedding complete with spiders, skulls and even an all-black wedding dress! David Tutera wants to lighten up the festivities, but first he'll have to convince the bride to try on a little wedding white.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen

programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Two" - After barely surviving the opening night of the Hell's Kitchen restaurant, the contestants prepare for their second dinner service.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 1, Day Three" - The budding chefs prepare for their third dinner service, but the pressure of Hell's Kitchen is too much for one contestant.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Seascape
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay must work with a hard-headed chef and inexperienced owners to make some changes and bring customers back to Seascape.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: The Olde Stone Mill
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to The Olde Stone Mill in Tuckahoe, New York. Although the front has been renovated, the kitchen still serves less-than-stellar food.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Trobiano's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay tries to help Italian restaurant Trobiano's. When Ramsay confronts the owner about the cleanliness of the kitchen and the tastiness of the food, tensions rise.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Black Pearl
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Black Pearl, a seafood restaurant that has three owners, each running the kitchen in a different manner. This leads to a confused staff and variable quality in food.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Mojito's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mojito's, a Cuban eatery in Brooklyn. The owners purchased the restaurant as newlyweds, but they are now seven years into a crumbling marriage and business.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Handlebar
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Mount Sinai, New York to help spruce up Bill and Carolyn LeRoy's Handlebar restaurant and lounge, which looks like it's stuck in the 1980s.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Peter's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Peter's, a family-run Italian restaurant in Babylon, New York. He discovers that the eatery is sinking because of its brash manager and co-owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: PJ's Steakhouse
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse, a restaurant that is dying due to management's lack of control and poor food quality.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Fine McCool's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits the family-run Finn McCool's in Westhampton, New York and faces an obnoxious head chef who happens to be the owner's son.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sante Le Brea
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to LA to inspect Sante La Brea. He discovers a financially strapped owner who isn't respected by his staff. And an incident that occurs in the eatery leads to a police visit.

programme.title: Teen Mom OG
programme.desc: In 16 & Pregnant, they were moms-to-be. Now, follow Farrah, Maci, Amber, and Catelynn as they face the challenges of their first year of motherhood.

programme.title: Teen Mom
programme.desc: "Teen Mom OG" will break the fourth wall, pulling back the curtain to reveal their relationships with the producers and crew, the challenges of raising children on camera, and how life in the public eye has shaped them as parents and people.

programme.title: Dos Aguas

programme.title: Francisco, El Jesuita - s1 | e1

programme.title: Once Upon A Date
programme.desc: Josh, agente de bienes raíces, es enviado a adquirir un teatro y se enamora de la hija del propietario.

programme.title: When Duty Calls
programme.desc: "Aspirante policía Ellie y su esposo Martín se mueven temporalmente con los padres de Ellie mientras espera una apertura en el departamento del sheriff. Su romance es desafiada cuando Ellie trabaja para resolver una serie de robos en su comunidad."

programme.title: Soldier Love Story
programme.desc: Un soldado regresa a su hogar, conoce al niño que le estuvo escribiendo y surge el amor entre él y la madre.

programme.title: Home Fires Burning
programme.desc: En un pueblo de Georgia, un editor local se molesta por los cambios producidos por la 2da Guerra mundial.

programme.title: In Need of Romance S1 EP12
programme.desc: In-young feels love for Sung-hyun. However, Sung-hyun neglects her due to busy work. She thinks about whether to trust a man again. In-young and Seo-yeon go out to find Hyun-joo because of her text message in the middle of the night. While Seo-youn invites Jun to her house and is having a good time, Alex visits her.

programme.title: Harmony
programme.desc: A group of female inmates form a choir inside a prison

programme.title: Good Morning President
programme.desc: Three successive presidents of South Korea face political and personal issues including special pardon for an ex-president, diplomatic tension and a marriage crisis.

programme.title: The Accidental Detective
programme.desc: A true-crime enthusiast, Dae-Man and a Sr. Detective Noh now demoted under his Jr. investigate together to find the true murderer their friend is accused of.

programme.title: The K2 EP10
programme.desc: In the midst of a war of power, Jae-ha and Anna begin a pure but dangerous love affair.Sung-won and Anna begin to fight Yoo-jin in earnest. Yoo-jin keeps them in check and she still wants to keep Jae-ha by her side. Meanwhile, Park Kwan-soo started a massive counterattack by putting the brakes on Yoo-Jin's move. Jang Se-joon and Choi Yoo-jin, who are in a state of beleaguered, make a decision, and Jae-ha finally starts hunting Park Kwan-soo.

programme.title: The K2 EP11
programme.desc: Chief Kim, whose position has been compromised due to Jae-ha, order secret instructions to kill Jae-ha disguised as an accident during the hunting of Park Kwan-soo. At the moment of successful infiltration into the Park Kwan-soo's hideout, the situation enters another phase with Park Kwan-soo's new proposal. Meanwhile, Anna's revenge begins and she deliberately exposes herself to the public, pressing Yoo-jin. Then one day, an information from the prison came and a man who was at the scene the day Um Hye-rin died appeared.

programme.title: The Tag Along
programme.desc: A famed urban legend of a little girl in a red dress who makes those she follows disappear comes to life.

programme.title: Tag-Along: Devil Fish
programme.desc: After accidentally releasing a demonic fish to the world, two students must work with a spirit medium to destroy it.

programme.title: Hide and Never Seek
programme.desc: A found-footage horror flick in the form of a livestream broadcast. AfreekaTV VJs Glow and Park investigate supernatural mysteries for their live audience--but with this missing student's game of hide-and-seek, they may be getting more than they bargained for.

programme.title: One Missed Call
programme.desc: A mysterious phone curse, where a phone message ends with your own death scream, spreads among Tokyo teens.

programme.title: Ringu 0

programme.title: The Vanished
programme.desc: The body of Jin-han's wife whom Jin-han secretly murdered suddenly disappears. The mystery and the suspense surrounding the disappearance grows bigger and bigger.

programme.title: Glass Garden

programme.title: MAL-MO-E: The Secret Mission

programme.desc: After putting the 'Omija Club' posters on, 'Dan' takes Cho-i to a fancy restaurant to cheer her up. The place is quite expensive for students. Admiring the classy interior, Cho-i overhears people talking on her way to the restroom. While 'Won-du' finds the posters on the wall and joins the 'Omija Club.'

programme.title: LOVE AS YOU TASTE: S1 E4
programme.desc: Coming back from class, Cho-i finds out that her house is clean. Maybe her mom stopped by. Plus, her mom made a lot of Kimbap. She sends a group message to 'Omija' but looks like everyone is busy. Eventually, Won-du, her next-door neighbor, joins her. When Dan finds out that Cho-i is eating Kimbap with Won-du, alone, he packs his bag and leaves class.

We have eyes and ears around the globe and you, our top agent, must decipher six clues to find and detain the world's most notorious comedy criminals. This is Mission Laughter!

programme.title: AFV's Top 8 Showcase: Giggles and Grins Edition
programme.desc: Episode 103 - Guess what time it is? It's time to laugh! So sit back, relax, and get ready to LOL at top 8 videos from the AFV library. Hosted by Lili Fifield.

programme.title: Hot 100 Countdown
programme.desc: Episode 110 - It's time to countdown the hottest 100 laugh tracks to see which hilarious video get the Platinum Video of the Week. This is the Hot 100 Countdown!

programme.title: AFV's Bonehead Brigade Countdown: Gym Class Fails
programme.desc: Episode 109 - ATTEN-SHUN! Welcome to the Bonehead Brigade, if you bumble, stumble, fall, flip or fail, we want you! Our mission? To save the world, one belly laugh at a time!

programme.title: AFV's Ultimate Top 1000 Countdown
programme.desc: Episode 101 - We're counting down the top 1000 videos of the year. Get ready to laugh your face off as Alfonso Ribeiro brings you the most hilarious and shocking fails of 2020.

programme.title: AFV's Prank Academy: Your Favorite Pranks
programme.desc: Episode 101 - Hosted by influencers Rachel Mueller and David Bonfadini, Prank Academy features the most hilarious pranks by kids for kids.

programme.title: OMG! Pets Countdown
programme.desc: Episode 107 - Welcome to OMG Pets Top 10 Countdown! The show where we bring you the doggiest of doggos, the cattiest of catties, and the birdiest of birdies, and much, much more!

programme.title: Top 100 Fails Countdown
programme.desc: Episode 104 - Welcome to the Top 100 Fails Countdown! On this show, the only way to win is to fail. We've got hundreds of fails, but there can be only one final fail winner.

programme.title: Epic Funny Video Countdown
programme.desc: Episode 120 - We're counting down the 100 funniest videos of all time...and each one is EPIC! Hope your ready for funny videos like "Kids Say The Craziest Things," All the Babies, What The Family?!, and Goofs with the Gals!"....because each one is EPIC!

programme.title: AFV's This Just In
programme.desc: Episode 108 - This Just In brings you the latest in the most hilarious videos from the AFV library.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Greg Morton - I Started Out, as a Baby
programme.desc: Greg Morton had only two choices in schoolyard conflicts. Learn the ways of the force, or use his wit to diffuse situations. That wit would soon lead to winning first prize in the, ‘So You Think You’re Funny Contest’ and the beginning of his stand-up comedy career. He was no longer the shy introverted kid, drawing cartoons in the corner. He had finally found his voice. A voice he would later use to direct and voice over twenty Saturday Morning cartoons. This former mobile disc jockey, who used to play songs at weddings, now sings song parodies on nationally syndicated radio shows, like the Bob and Tom Show. Take his Obama Man, sung to the tune of Candy Man, which has racked up over 4 million hits on YouTube.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jesse Egan - That's the Spirit
programme.desc: San Diego native Jesse Egan jokes about hitting on women in a smart car, hippie drive-bys, and the gluten free craze.

programme.title: Tom Clark - I'm A Rescue
programme.desc: Tom Clark was born and raised, in that order. Clark’s mix of well-crafted jokes and spontaneous crowd work has led to appearances on TBS’s ‘Conan,’ CBS’s ‘Late Late Show, and Comedy Central’s ‘Premium Blend’. Clark has traveled coast to coast doing stand up and has performed internationally as part of New Faces at the prestigious‘Just For Laughs Comedy Festival’ in Montreal and on The Main Stage at ‘The Capetown Comedy Festival’ in South Africa. Clark is also an actor and has appeared on such shows as NBC’s ‘Outsourced’, TNT’s ‘The Closer’,and the Hallmark made for TV movie ‘The Wish List’. After landing the role on ‘Outsourced,’ director Ken Kwapis invited Clark to be in the Drew Barrymore movie, ‘Big Miracle’. You can also see Clark in Columbia Pictures ‘Freaks of Nature.’

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Ricky Glore - Dad Bod
programme.desc: New dad Ricky Glore riffs on wife hacks, dogs dying in horror films, and impersonations of celebrities while reading nursery rhymes

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Ryan Erwin - Vertical Claps
programme.desc: He was awarded the 2018 Teaching Star of the Year winner by the Utah Middle School Teachers Association. His comedy comes a variety of sources from growing up with two deaf parents, to asking for the details on the latest girl drama at his school.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Steve Bruner - Simply Put
programme.desc: Steve Bruner looks like a perfectly normal guy—until he opens his mouth. He’s delivered his laser-sharp humor on Comedy Club Network (Showtime), An Evening at the Improv (A&E), Into the Night (ABC), and The Byron Allen Show (NBC), to name a few.

programme.title: Joe Devito - First Of All
programme.desc: Joe DeVito's dead-on timing and unexpected twists make him a favorite at comedy clubs across the USA. His TV appearances include The Late Late Show, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed, and AXStv’s Gotham Comedy Live. He’s also a regular on TV news panels, finding the funny in pop culture and current events. Joe’s albums First Date with Joe DeVito and Three’s Comedy are in regular rotation on SiriusXM radio.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jeff Shaw - Manly Girly Man
programme.desc: Jeff Shaw's writing is marked both by idealism and humanity. His stimulating satire is often infused with poetic beauty. More importantly, he looks like Rod Stewart.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Robert G. Lee - Laughter's Still Legal!
programme.desc: Proud smart aleck Robert G. Lee jokes about performing in a prison, Millennial baseball, and over-protective parents.

programme.title: Robert Mac - Know More
programme.desc: Robert's award-winning comedy is smart, subtle, and silly. Not too smart and not too subtle, but occasionally a bit more silly than youíd expect. And always clean. Robert is a regular at some of the finest comedy clubs around the country. Winner of "Comedy Centralís Laugh Riots." Finalist at "Billy Crystalís Mr. Saturday Night Contest", "San Francisco International Comedy Competition", "Boston Comedy Festival", "Jerry Lewis MDA Telethon Talent Search."

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Tyler Boeh - Wait For It
programme.desc: Who goes from being a mild-mannered nationally recognized college a Capella group vocal percussionist to becoming a high-energy, intelligent, physical, and downright silly beatboxing comedian? None other than Comedian Tyler Boeh, who shifted his focus from singing a Capella (a word he describes as Latin for “Without Girlfriend”) when he won a comedy contest in Portland Oregon. After winning and placing in the finals of numerous Comedy Competitions from San Francisco to Seattle to Boston to The World Series of Comedy, Boeh not only launched a great career in comedy including television appearances, colleges, cruise ships and headlining clubs, he also found a girlfriend. Tyler’s comedy CD was chosen by LaughSpin Magazine as the Best Comedy Album of 2012 and you may have seen him on such shows as Celebrity Name Game, Moms Rule, Nesn Comedy All Stars, or heard him on SIRIUS radio. Don’t miss a chance to see Tyler live.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: K-Von - Designer Muscles
programme.desc: Half-Persian and raised in a religious family, K-Von's comedy unites sharp cultural riffs with clean delivery. In this special he takes on political correctness, cyber bullying, and the utility of cargo pants.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Maher Matta - Personally Speaking
programme.desc: Born in Lebanon and raised in the American South, Maher Matta jokes about flying while Arab, using Rogaine at fifteen, and working as a state trooper.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Dave Nihill - Documented
programme.desc: Dave is the winner of the prestigious 43rd annual San Francisco Comedy Competition, and runner up in the Moth’s largest US Grandslam storytelling competition.

programme.title: Daren Streblow - Organic and Inorganic Life
programme.desc: Daren Streblow’s unique style of observational stand-up comedy has been entertaining hundreds-of-thousands of people throughout the United States and around the world since he first stepped on the stage in 1995. Daren headlines churches, fundraisers, corporate functions, and colleges all over North America. He’s a “humor opportunist” who is always looking for the comical side of life and how people live it. He takes topics that everyone can relate to and filters them through his unique lens where connecting A to B leads to a letter in the Greek alphabet or maybe salad dressing.

programme.title: Matt Besser: Besser Breaks The Record
programme.desc: Matt Besser is here to air some grievances and break some comedy records.

programme.title: Jamie Kennedy: Uncomfortable
programme.desc: Jamie Kennedy is hilarious as he reveals his life observations including his dating Jennifer Love Hewitt.

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny
programme.desc: Several popular female comedians like Tammy Pescatelli, Lynne Koplitz.

programme.title: Coming To The Stage - Season 4
programme.desc: The fourth episode of Coming To The Stage features Barbara Gray & Danny Soloman, hosted by Andy Kindler.

programme.title: Coming To The Stage - Season 6
programme.desc: Famous actor and stand-up comedian George Wallace welcomes Amy Silverberg & Noah Findling to the stage.

programme.title: Coming To The Stage - Season 3
programme.desc: In the Season 3 premiere, new host, Tom Green, introduces us to Kevin Christy & Mo Welch.

programme.title: Coming To The Stage - Season 3
programme.desc: In this episode, host Tom Green brings Matthew Broussard & Jared Moskowitz to the stage.

programme.title: Tom Arnold: Past & Present Imperfectly
programme.desc: This special is about what life's life now for a former meat packer & father of two.

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: Safety - Harm Hides At Home
programme.desc: Your home is crawling with hazards! You are not safe! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill as they riff Safety - Harm Hides At Home!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Kiss Of The Tarantula
programme.desc: RiffTrax, the guys who make movies funny, bring their comedic riffing treatment to this twisted classic horror movie where a beautiful spider-loving mortician's daughter unleashes tarantula-filled revenge on all who wrong her! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (former stars of Mystery Science Theater 3000 aka MST3K).

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: Shy Guy
programme.desc: How can shyness be conquered? Join Mike, Kevin and Bill as they learn how to stop being the Shy Guy in this hilarious short!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX PRESENTS - Horror Express
programme.desc: A frozen monster being transported via the trans-Siberian express breaks free and starts killing off the passengers. Join Matthew J. Elliot as he take a hilarious ride on the Horror Express!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Don't Be a Bloody Idiot
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this 1970s Australian camping safety short. Join Mike, Kevin, Bill and one angry Australian with a gun for Don't Be a Bloody Idiot.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - The Last Slumber Party
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this movie about a psychopath who crashes a teen's slumber party. The fashion is 80s, the soundtrack is hair metal, the poster on the wall is inexplicably of Sesame Street, and the Shelley Hack references are more abundant than every other RiffTrax we’ve ever done combined. Slip into your footie pajamas and join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for The Last Slumber Party!

programme.title: RiffTrax Shorts: It Must Be The Neighbors
programme.desc: Take a journey of neighborly blame with three of the finger-pointingist, buck-passingist neighbors you know— Mike, Kevin and Bill as they riff It Must Be The Neighbors!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Manos The Hands Of Fate (studio)
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K riff the classic Manos - the Hands of Fate! Run, don’t stumble-walk-with-accursed-goat-legs to watch RiffTrax: Manos The Hands Of Fate!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Drugs Are Like That
programme.desc: There are so many things to which drugs can be compared that to even attempt to catalog them would be an act of incomprehensible madness. Yet in this pastel colored, 1970's nightmare, two hard-of-hearing, loggorrheic pre-teens are up to the task! Have you always wondered, Are drugs like pumpkins? Like small willow saplings? Like those bags of cotton candy you can buy in gift shops? Find out as Mike, Kevin and Bill go once more unto the breach!

programme.title: RiffTrax: The Power
programme.desc: Join Mike, Kevin, Bill, and a harmless little tiki idol that Kevin brought back from Hawaii for The Power! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).
